tourName: Japan small group holiday by bullet train
placesVisited: Tokyo, Hakone NP, Kamikochi National Park, Osaka, Kyoto, Tea ceremony with maiko, overnight stays in traditional ryokan inns, Hot spring baths, Takayama, Matsumoto
generalInfo:
This Small Group Tour combines the famous cultural sights of Japan with the staggering natural beauty of its mountainous region. You'll visit the “golden route”: Tokyo, Kyoto and Hakone, but also spend four days in and around the beautiful Japan Alps – including Kamikochi National Park, a place we think is a contender for one of the most stunning on Earth.
With our Insider guide connections and know-how, you can see the best of Japan's ancient culture, modern-day cities, and stunning nature all in a two-week trip.

•Tokyo – Begin in the electric capital, using historic Asakusa as your base. Explore modern districts, ancient temples, and old Edo charm.
•Hakone – Cruise Lake Ashi on a pirate ship with Mount Fuji on the horizon, and try eggs boiled in volcanic hot springs.
•Kyoto – Share tea with a maiko (trainee geisha) in a rare, Insider-only cultural encounter.
•Osaka – Feast on street-food favourites like okonomiyaki, takoyaki, and kushikatsu. Optional day trip to Nara and its friendly deer.
•Takayama, Japan Alps – Wander an extensive preserved merchant district, sample local sake, and discover master woodcarving traditions in this mountain-shielded historic town.
•Kamikochi – Hike one of the most beautiful alpine valleys on Earth, with snow-capped peaks, glacial rivers, macaque monkeys, and fresh mountain air. Stay in nearby Hirayu Onsen for outdoor hot-spring views.
Two nights at every stop means you can truly soak in each destination without rushing. By the end, your idea of “Classic Japan” may be forever changed.

Dietary requirements
We can cater for vegetarian diets on all of our Small Group Tours. Vegan diets can usually be accommodated, though options may be more limited on certain itineraries—particularly in remote areas where meals are provided by local accommodations. In these cases, vegan travellers should expect simpler meals than the standard offering, but we’ll always do our best to make it work.

dayInfo.description: TOKYO (dinner) | Today you will touch down in Tokyo, the tenth most populous city in the world. You will be met at the airport by your driver and transfer by shared shuttle bus to your hotel in the Asakusa district of the city. The tour leader will be waiting to meet you in the hotel lobby and in the evening we will all head out to a local restaurant for an introductory group meal – the perfect way to begin getting to know each other.

TOKYO (breakfast) | Tokyo is an international byword for hyper-modernity but there are still little pockets of history left for those who look. Asakusa is one of these pockets. We’ll explore Asakusa and visit Senso-ji – Tokyo's oldest temple. Later your tour leader will lead a guided tour of some of the city's other famous sites - from the madness of Shibuya's scramble crossing to the towering neon arcades of Akihabara and plenty in between. The highlight of today is likely to be a visit to the beautiful oasis of Hamarikyu Gardens near Tokyo Bay.

HAKONE (breakfast & dinner) | Today we move closer to Mount Fuji, to Hakone National Park in the foothills of Japan’s most sacred mountain. Here we'll stay very close to the Hakone Open-Air Museum, home to works by Picasso, Miro, Rodin and Henry Moore set amid stunning mountain scenery.

HAKONE (breakfast & dinner) | Hakone has a wealth of attractions to offer. Quaint traditional buildings, a pirate ship cruise across Lake Ashi, hot spring baths – not to mention spectacular views of Mount Fuji when the weather is clear! You'll have the chance to do all this and more on day four as your tour leader shows you some of the area's finest spots.

OSAKA (breakfast) | We take the world famous Shinkansen (bullet train) to travel on to Osaka, an exciting city famous for its down to earth people and superb street food. After exploring Osaka Castle and its great museum join your tour leader to experience the vibrant Dotonbori district and sample the local specialities such as takoyaki (octopus balls) and okonomiyaki (savoury pancake).

OSAKA (breakfast) | On day six you will have a free day to do whatever you choose. Hiroshima, Himeji Castle and the ancient imperial capital of Nara all make excellent day trips from Osaka – your tour leader will be heading to one of these great destinations, but will also be able to advise you should you decide to branch off somewhere else.

KYOTO (breakfast & dinner) | Kyoto was the capital of Japan for over one thousand years between 794 and 1868, an illustrious history that has left it with an incredible collection of historical landmarks. Your tour leader will introduce you to some of the city’s best sights. This evening we’ll visit a small tea house to meet for an audience with a Geisha; a truly unique insight into this hidden world. We’ve also included dinner at one of the city's many fantastic restaurants.

KYOTO (breakfast) | We have a private coach available for today's sightseeing and will be joined by an expert local guide. We will visit a number of Kyoto’s iconic shrines, temples and gardens as well as taking in other highlights such as the bamboo groves of Arashiyama.

TAKAYAMA (breakfast) | We take the Shinkansen and then a limited express train high into the Japanese Alps to the mountain town of Takayama, This is a beautiful town with lots of traditional wooden architecture, craft shops, sake breweries and markets. In Takayama we stay at a traditional Japanese-style Inn and a fantastic multi course meal will be included as part of the stay.

TAKAYAMA (breakfast) | Day ten offers a full day in Takayama, and there is plenty to see and do to keep you busy. We’ll begin the day by visiting the riverside morning markets, then head to the Hida no Sato folk village, an open-air museum showcasing the region's traditional thatched farmhouses. Dinner is not included this evening, so we recommend heading out for a taste of Hida beef – just as tasty as its famous Kobe cousin!

JAPAN ALPS (breakfast & dinner) | We head higher into the mountains by bus today to reach Hirayu Onsen where we will be staying for 2 nights. On the way we will stop off for a ride on the Shinhotaka Ropeway, a thrilling cable car ride with stunning mountain views. After checking into our hot spring accommodation in Hirayu Onsen you have the chance to relax, take a soak in the onsen and enjoy a delicious Japanese-style dinner with the group.

JAPAN ALPS (breakfast & dinner) | Kamikochi, in our opinion, is one of the most beautiful locations in the whole of Japan and today you will be visiting the national park for a full day. There are lots of walking and hiking trails for all abilities so we suggest pulling on your walking boots. With a bit of luck you’ll spot some wild monkeys and in the late afternoon you will have time to relax and enjoy the area's superb onsen baths before another included dinner at your hotel.

TOKYO (breakfast & dinner) | We return to Tokyo by bus and train, stopping on the way to visit the impressive “Black Crow” samurai castle of Matsumoto – one of the best original castles in Japan. After exploring here, we’ll take the train back to Tokyo’s lively Shinjuku district allowing a little time for some last-minute souvenir shopping or to fit in one last sightseeing stop. As the last evening of the tour, we hope you’ll join the tour leader for a final dinner, a few drinks and perhaps some karaoke!
DEPART (breakfast) | It's time to say goodbye to your travelling companions and board your flight home. A transfer back to the airport is included.
